title: Google\Cloud\Debugger\DebuggerClient
name: DebuggerClient
description: Google Stackdriver Debugger allows you to collect variable data from a live application and display it in the Google Cloud Platform Console. Find more information at Stackdriver Debugger API docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: config.apiEndpoint
params.description: A hostname with optional port to use in place of the service's default endpoint.

params.name: config.projectId
params.description: The project ID from the Google Developer's Console.

params.name: config.authCache
params.description: A cache used storing access tokens. Defaults to a simple in memory implementation.

params.name: config.authCacheOptions
params.description: Cache configuration options.

params.name: config.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests specifically for authentication.

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.keyFile
params.description: The contents of the service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developer's Console. Ex: json_decode(file_get_contents($path), true).

params.name: config.keyFilePath
params.description: The full path to your service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developers Console.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Defaults to 3.

params.name: config.scopes
params.description: Scopes to be used for the request.

methods.name: debuggee
methods.description: Lazily instantiate a debuggee. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on a debuggee, please see Google\Cloud\Debugger\Debuggee.

params.name: id
params.description: The debuggee identifier

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.uniquifier
params.description: Debuggee uniquifier within the project. Any string that identifies the application within the project can be used. Including environment and version or build IDs is recommended.

params.name: options.description
params.description: Human readable description of the debuggee. Including a human-readable project name, environment name and version information is recommended.

params.name: options.isInactive
params.description: If set to true, indicates that the debuggee is considered as inactive by the Controller service.

params.name: options.status
params.description: Human readable message to be displayed to the user about this debuggee. Absence of this field indicates no status. The message can be either informational or an error status.

params.name: options.extSourceContexts
params.description: References to the locations and revisions of the source code used in the deployed application.

methods.name: debuggees
methods.description: Fetches all the debuggees in the project.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.includeInactive
params.description: When set to true, the result includes all debuggees. Otherwise, the result includes only debuggees that are active.

params.name: options.clientVersion
params.description: The client version making the call. Schema: domain/type/version (e.g., google.com/intellij/v1).
